title: Nationwide Assessment of the Ghana School Feeding Programme
challenge: Government needed an evidence-based assessment of GSFP to unlock additional financing and improve programme delivery.
approach: Led a World Bank–supported nationwide assessment covering 16 regions; engaged MMDA officials, head teachers, caterers, and beneficiary households; synthesized operational, financial, and nutrition data to produce recommendations for scale-up.
outcomes: Assessment report produced with prioritized reform roadmap
Stakeholder validation across 5 macro-regions completed
Recommendations adopted for funding negotiations

title: Boosting Green Employment and Enterprise Opportunities (GrEEn)
challenge: Youth unemployment and limited green enterprise capacity constrained local livelihoods.
approach: Served as Project Manager supporting SNV and UNCDF to coordinate MSME coaching, green jobs fairs, and municipality-level enterprise enablement with MLGRD and MELR.
outcomes: Coordinated delivery of enterprise coaching cohorts
Linked MSMEs to municipal opportunity pipelines
Improved local government support to green entrepreneurship

title: National Clean Cooking Strategy Task Team
challenge: High reliance on polluting fuels caused health and environmental burdens.
approach: Served on national task team drafting a Clean Cooking Strategy; aligned targets with health, environment and gender outcomes; mapped financing and market enablers.
outcomes: Draft national strategy framework prepared
Market barriers and enablers mapped
Stakeholder inputs consolidated for policy finalization

title: SISTARS Organisational Development for Women in STEM Leadership
challenge: Institutional barriers limited women’s progression into leadership in STEM-focused organisations.
approach: Facilitated OD plans for four organisations focusing on governance, inclusive policies, and leadership pipelines.
outcomes: 4 OD plans co-created and approved
Leadership pipeline actions identified per institution
Baseline gender metrics defined for tracking

title: NAFAG Governance Strengthening & Elections Support
challenge: The National Fisheries Association required constitutional updates and credible governance processes to improve accountability and member trust.
approach: Facilitated an organisational development programme for NAFAG that included constitution review workshops, member consultations, and a transparent electoral process; drafted SOPs and clarified operational roles.
outcomes: Updated constitution validated by members
Transparent board elections conducted
Operational roles and SOPs clarified

title: Sustainable Fisheries Management Project (SFMP) – Partner OD
location: Western, Central & Greater Accra Regions, Ghana
challenge: Partner CSOs required stronger systems to influence fisheries governance and to deliver programme activities effectively.
approach: Led organisational assessments and tailored OD interventions for nine partners, developed SOPs, strategic and advocacy plans, and delivered board and staff trainings in governance and accountability.
outcomes: 9 partner assessments and OD plans completed
Board and staff trained in governance & leadership
Administrative, financial, and OD manuals delivered

title: Anti-Child Labour & Trafficking Community Messaging
challenge: Child labour and trafficking risks required locally tailored messaging and better coordination among duty-bearers and community groups.
approach: Co-developed district-specific communication toolkits with 10 District Assemblies, trained local officials and community actors, and established referral pathways with social welfare services.
outcomes: 10 district-specific messaging toolkits produced
Community sensitization plan outlined
Referral pathways clarified with social welfare units

title: Water & Sanitation Social Enterprise Setup
challenge: A deprived community lacked affordable, reliable water and sanitation services and local livelihoods were constrained.
approach: Supported the establishment of a community social enterprise to operate water points and sanitation services, developed service protocols, business models, and trained staff in operations and financial management.
outcomes: Enterprise operationalized with basic service menu
Local employment created for youth and women
Community WASH service coverage increased

title: Social Public Expenditure & Financial Accountability (SPEFA) Project
challenge: Limited citizen engagement and transparency in public financial management at local government level.
approach: Coordinated a nationwide social accountability programme across 46 MMAs; trained 30 CSOs, organised town-hall meetings, and facilitated citizen engagement with state actors to improve public financial oversight.
outcomes: Quarterly team-building and capacity sessions for 30 CSOs
Improved citizen engagement mechanisms in 46 assemblies
Advocacy actions that increased budget transparency

title: Green Economy Strategy & Handbook (National)
challenge: Mainstreaming green economy principles into national and local planning was limited by lack of practical guidance and capacity.
approach: Developed a national Green Economy Strategy manual and trained MMDAs on mainstreaming green economy into MTDPs, accompanied by a trainers' handbook and capacity building sessions.
outcomes: Green Economy strategy manual published
Trainers handbook produced and roll-out training delivered
MMDAs equipped to integrate green economy principles into plans

title: Clean Cookstoves Education & Curriculum Integration
challenge: Lack of awareness and curriculum content on clean cooking and fuels for school-age children.
approach: Worked with World Education International and partners to develop clean cookstoves manuals and integrate content into GES curriculum; trained teachers and delivered community outreach to adolescent girls and school networks.
outcomes: Clean cookstoves training manual developed
Curriculum integration guidance delivered
Beneficiary training for adolescent girls and teachers

challenge: Fragmented clean cookstoves initiatives needed a national coordinating platform to scale adoption and market development.
approach: Supported the establishment of GHACCO, coordinated stakeholder engagement, and contributed to partnership development and secretariat setup.
outcomes: GHACCO established and governance arrangements defined
Partnerships formed across NGOs and private sector
Advocacy platforms created to promote clean cooking uptake

approach: Coordinated an independent CSO monitoring and evaluation initiative across 69 districts, training local monitors and compiling baseline and monitoring reports.

Trained local monitors in 69 districts
Evidence used in advocacy and programme improvement
